participants: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire

messages.message: I just want to add that this was me "taking the discussion offline". We had said in the release weekly that we would decide on a date before the next meeting, which is Monday. Do we need to come up with a framework by which we can make a decision?
It sounds like the key customers involved are FRB, C1 and BAML
We also at some point mentioned quarterly releases to all customers, how is that tied in here? will the next release be the only release we do to customers for Q1?

When we say we'll have more clarity on Monday, is that because of the morning BAML meeting? It seems like discussing/deciding on a release date would be a key part of a release weekly meeting. Perhaps in Monday's release weekly, we can come in with all the necessary customer information (contract deadlines, requests, engineering time estimates, etc) and reach a decision then.

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message:
Hey @lydia :wave: I think we will have more clarity on the approach for BAML on Monday which can help inform our decision to push the release or not. 

To be clear, we have not told customers we are moving to a quarterly cadence. Iâ€™ve asked customers if they would prefer that but we have not officially communicated that we are moving to that model yet. My customers would prefer it.

There will be a transition time to get the quarterly releases that we need to account for. I think step 1 is determining if BAML pieces can even get complete if we decide to push the release back a few weeks - this is what we need to figure out on Monday

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: That can help us decide if we should just keep the date and have both a Jan and Feb release or push and have just one Feb release
